column4: hi guys how can I test which sata driver is used by my machine?
I got asus p5b mobo and barracuda 7200.10 hdd which supports ncq
does lsmod show anything about sata?
yes it does
what exactly? ?
unfortunately it shows both two drivers
ahci and ata_piix
so you would like to know which one is used? I think both it both are shown.
try modinfo <modName>
ok there is some additional info but how can I get information which hdd uses which driver?
they probably use both modules.
ahci supports ncq and other nice toys, while ata_piix is older one and doesn't support ncq
that is just a guess though, I have no idea.
I got two sata controllers onboard - intel ich8 and jmicron...
google a little with those models, to see what modules they use in linux is best advice I can come up with
!ru
thanks for help I just found some usefull information in hal-device-manager
welcome
and now I know that my hdd which is connected to ich8 controller with ata_piix driver while jmicron controller uses ahci driver...
cool
cool that I got this info but it sucks that my machine uses this driver - need to reboot and change bios settings
thanks again
